block.p: Dr. Rebecca Fran Gottesman, the daughter of Dr. Susan Gottesman and Dr. Michael Gottesman of Bethesda, Md., was married yesterday to Capt. Edward Tillett Goldstein, the son of Betty Goldstein of Manns Harbor, N.C., and Dr. Roger Goldstein of Glen Cove, N.Y. Rabbi Joel Braude officiated at Woodend, the headquarters of the Audubon Naturalist Society in Chevy Chase, Md.

The bride, 26, and the bridegroom, 27, graduated from Columbia University, where they met. Dr. Gottesman, who will continue to use her name professionally, received a medical degree from Columbia on Wednesday. Next month, she will become a resident in neurology at Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore.

Dr. Rebecca Fran Gottesman, the daughter of Dr. Susan Gottesman and Dr. Michael Gottesman of Bethesda, Md., was married yesterday to Capt. Edward Tillett Goldstein, the son of Betty Goldstein of Manns Harbor, N.C., and Dr. Roger Goldstein of Glen Cove, N.Y. Rabbi Joel Braude officiated at Woodend, the headquarters of the Audubon Naturalist Society in Chevy Chase, Md.

The bride, 26, and the bridegroom, 27, graduated from Columbia University, where they met. Dr. Gottesman, who will continue to use her name professionally, received a medical degree from Columbia on Wednesday. Next month, she will become a resident in neurology at Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore.

Her parents work at the National Cancer Institute in Bethesda, where her father is the deputy director for intramural research and chief of the cell biology laboratory and her mother is the chief of the biomedical genetics section in the molecular biology laboratory.

Captain Goldstein is a lawyer in the office of the chief counsel of the Army Corps of Engineers in Washington. He received a law degree from Yeshiva University. His father is the chairman of the political science department at the C. W. Post Campus of Long Island University.
